From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cavāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kəˈβa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [kəˈva]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kaˈvaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

cavar (first-person singular present cavo, first-person singular preterite caví, past participle cavat)

  1. to dig

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of cavar (first conjugation)
infinitive cavar
gerund cavant
past participle masculine feminine
singular cavat cavada
plural cavats cavades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present cavo caves cava cavem caveu caven
imperfect cavava cavaves cavava cavàvem cavàveu cavaven
future cavaré cavaràs cavarà cavarem cavareu cavaran
preterite caví cavares cavà cavàrem cavàreu cavaren
conditional cavaria cavaries cavaria cavaríem cavaríeu cavarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present cavi cavis cavi cavem caveu cavin
imperfect cavés cavessis cavés cavéssim cavéssiu cavessin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — cava cavi cavem caveu cavin
negative (no) — no cavis no cavi no cavem no caveu no cavin

Related terms

[edit]
  • excavar
  • soscavar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “cavar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese cavar (13th century, Cantigas de Santa Maria), from Latin cavāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kaˈβaɾ/

Verb

[edit]

cavar (first-person singular present cavo, first-person singular preterite cavei, past participle cavado)

  1. to dig
  2. to hoe
    • 1303, Clarinda de Azevedo Maia (ed.), História do galego-português. Estado linguístico da Galiza e do Noroeste de Portugal do século XII ao século XVI (com referência á situação do galego moderno). Coimbra: I.N.I.C., page 150:
      Et dardeſ cada anno quatro dias de ſeara a noſſa graña de Pineyra, ṽn dia a eſcauar, outro a pudar, outro a cauar, outro a rãdar
      You'll give each year four days of work in our farm of Piñeira, one day for digging, another for prunning, another for hoeing, another for weeding
  3. to break up

[edit]

  • Antón Luís Santamarina Fernández, Ernesto Xosé González Seoane, María Álvarez de la Granja, editors (2003–2018), “cavar”, in Tesouro informatizado da lingua galega (in Galician), Santiago de Compostela: Instituto da Lingua Galega

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan, from Latin cavō, cavāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

cavar

  1. to dig

Conjugation

[edit]

Related terms

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese, from Latin cavāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kaˈva(ʁ)/ [kaˈva(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kaˈva(ʁ)/ [kaˈva(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kaˈva(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kaˈva(ʁ)/ [kaˈva(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kaˈva(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kɐˈvaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kɐˈvaɾ/
    • (Northern Portugal) IPA(key): /kɐˈbaɾ/ [kɐˈβaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kɐˈva.ɾi/

Verb

[edit]

cavar (first-person singular present cavo, first-person singular preterite cavei, past participle cavado)

  1. to dig, excavate, burrow, scoop

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of cavar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal cavar
Personal cavar cavares cavar cavarmos cavardes cavarem
Gerund
cavando
Past participle
Masculine cavado cavados
Feminine cavada cavadas
Indicative
Present cavo cavas cava cavamos cavais cavam
Imperfect cavava cavavas cavava cavávamos caváveis cavavam
Preterite cavei cavaste cavou cavamos1, cavámos2 cavastes cavaram
Pluperfect cavara cavaras cavara caváramos caváreis cavaram
Future cavarei cavarás cavará cavaremos cavareis cavarão
Conditional cavaria cavarias cavaria cavaríamos cavaríeis cavariam
Subjunctive
Present cave caves cave cavemos caveis cavem
Imperfect cavasse cavasses cavasse cavássemos cavásseis cavassem
Future cavar cavares cavar cavarmos cavardes cavarem
Imperative
Affirmative cava cave cavemos cavai cavem
Negative (não) não caves não cave não cavemos não caveis não cavem

1Brazilian Portuguese.
2European Portuguese.

Related terms

[edit]
  • cava
  • escavar

Romansch

[edit]

Alternative forms

[edit]
  • stgavar (Rumantsch Grischun, Sutsilvan, Surmiran)
  • tgavar (Surmiran)
  • chaver (Puter)
  • chavar (Vallader)

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cavō, cavāre.

Verb

[edit]

cavar

  1. (Sursilvan) to dig

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Latin cavāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /kaˈbaɾ/ [kaˈβ̞aɾ]
  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: ca‧var

Verb

[edit]

cavar (first-person singular present cavo, first-person singular preterite cavé, past participle cavado)

  1. (transitive) to excavate, dig
  2. (intransitive) to penetrate into

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of cavar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive cavar
gerund cavando
past participle masculine feminine
singular cavado cavada
plural cavados cavadas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present cavo cavastú
cavásvos 		cava cavamos caváis cavan
imperfect cavaba cavabas cavaba cavábamos cavabais cavaban
preterite cavé cavaste cavó cavamos cavasteis cavaron
future cavaré cavarás cavará cavaremos cavaréis cavarán
conditional cavaría cavarías cavaría cavaríamos cavaríais cavarían
subjunctive yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present cave cavestú
cavésvos2 		cave cavemos cavéis caven

(ra) 		cavara cavaras cavara caváramos cavarais cavaran

(se) 		cavase cavases cavase cavásemos cavaseis cavasen
future1 cavare cavares cavare caváremos cavareis cavaren
imperative — tú
vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ustedes
affirmative cavatú
cavávos 		cave cavemos cavad caven
negative no caves no cave no cavemos no cavéis no caven

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

Derived terms

[edit]
  • cavar su propia tumba

Related terms

[edit]
  • cava
  • cavador
  • caverna
  • escavar
  • excavar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “cavar”, in Diccionario de la lengua española [Dictionary of the Spanish Language] (in Spanish), online version 23.8, Royal Spanish Academy [Spanish: Real Academia Española], 10 December 2024

Venetan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cavō, cavāre.

Verb

[edit]

cavar

  1. (transitive) to take off, take out
  2. (transitive) to extract

Conjugation

[edit]

* Venetan conjugation varies from one region to another. Hence, the following conjugation should be considered as typical, not as exhaustive.

Conjugation of cavar (first conjugation)
infinitive cavar
auxiliary verb aver gerund cavando
past participle cavà
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative mi ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
present cavo (te) cavi (el/ła) cava cavémo, cavòn cavé (i/łe) cava
imperfect cavava (te) cavavi (el/ła) cavava cavàvimo cavavi (i/łe) cavava
future cavarò (te) cavarè (el/ła) cavarà cavarémo cavarè (i/łe) cavarà
conditional cavarìa (te) cavarisi (el/ła) cavarìa cavarìsimo cavarisi (i/łe) cavarìa
subjunctive che mi che ti che eło / eła che noialtri / noialtre che voialtri / voialtre che łuri / łore
present cave, cava (te) cavi (el/ła) cave, (el/ła) cava cavémo, cavone cavé (i/łe) cave, (i/łe) cava
imperfect cavase (te) cavasi (el/ła) cavase cavàsimo cavasi (i/łe) cavase
imperative — ti eło / eła noialtri / noialtre voialtri / voialtre łuri / łore
— (te) cava (el/ła) cava, (el/ła) cave cavémo cavé (i/łe) cava, (i/łe) cave

Related terms
